technology.short_description: Many herds of fine Elven steeds roam freely on Ulthuan's wide plains, but can be called to battle when needed.
Only when there is dire need can the most ancient examples be roused from their slumber.
The renowned smiths of Vaul and Hoeth forge greatswords so light and well-balanced they appear to be no lighter than a feather.
In solemn witnesses to a dwindling race, the Ten Kingdoms’ armouries contain more enchanted armaments than there are Elves to wield them.
Having a surplus of the finest building materials says something about a society's inherent wealth.
"Pain, begone, I will have no more of thee!"
One of the most impressive, iconic sights of an Elven warhost is the wall of spears, perfectly arranged for maximum effect.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for High Elf Spearmen, Gate Guard, Lothern Sea Guard and Silverin Guard

technology.short_description: Ithilmar is an unusual substance in that it offers full protection but without the encumbrance of a full suit of plate armour.
The cadence of military music enables the maintenance of order and discipline in the fray's desperate, blood-soaked moments.
The world's best archers require the very best arrows.

effects.description: Ammunition: +10% for Archers, Gate Guard, Lothern Sea Guard, Ellyrian Reaver Archers, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers, Sisters of Avalorn, Tiranoc Chariot and Lothern Skycutter units
Missile strength: +10% for Archers, Gate Guard, Lothern Sea Guard, Ellyrian Reaver Archers, Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers, Sisters of Avelorn, Chariot and Lothern Skycutter units

technology.short_description: The forgemasters of the Dragon Spine have laboured through centuries to perfect intricacies unseen by the fleeting races of the world.
Wide, flat-headed arrows are both easy to store and more effective at slicing through massed ranks of the foe than standard designs.
Just as the citizen levy hones their sword hand, so too does courtly intrigue sharpen the keen minds of Ulthuan nobility for statecraft.

effects.description: Speed: +10% for White Lions of Chrace, Swordmasters of Hoeth, Sisters of Avelorn and Phoenix Guard units

technology.short_description: Only the very best blades are made from star-metal; only Dwarfen gromril comes close in hardness and strength.
Just as the citizen levy hones their sword hand, so too does courtly intrigue sharpen the keen minds of Ulthuan nobility for statecraft.
Both the song and the singer are crucial if Dragon and rider are to form a bond that lasts a lifetime.

effects.description: Melee defence: +4 for Dragon and Dragon Prince units

technology.short_description: There is a time for games of court and there is a time for games of war. All of Ulthuan's sons and daughters will come to its defense when called.
Leading by example, the mighty High Elven Princes stand firm on the front lines, implacable and unyielding.
Tor Yvresse shines with some of its splendor of old, inspiring the Warden's kin.
Those who serve the Grim Warden know the Greenskins to be their ultimate enemy and they will stop at nothing to crush them.

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +100% when fighting against Greenskin Tribes
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: They will all fall.
Alarielle survived the last Druchii invasion thanks only to the last-minute intervention of Teclis; she will not allow Ulthuan to suffer such destruction again.

effects.description: Physical resistance: 5% when fighting against Dark Elves
Income from post-battle loot: +5% against Dark Elves
Gifts of Isha generated: +1 per turn

technology.short_description: All that the foul Druchii have stolen will be returned to Ulthuan.

effects.description: Income from post-battle loot: +10% against Dark Elves

technology.short_description: At home in the bitter, uninviting wilderness of Naggaroth, the Nagarythi patrol tirelessly.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -5%
	(own armies factionwide in enemy territory)

technology.short_description: Expecting succour, supplicants of Ladrielle – protectress of lost travellers in the wilds or upon the waves – often carry trinkets bearing her featureless visage.
"It will not take long before prayers to Mathlann find their way to your lips more readily than Kurnous or Asuryan."
In the navy standards are everything and all those amongst the ranks of the Sea Patrol need the latest equipment.
To rouse the fire of Asurian intensity is to command obedience – be they white-garbed neophytes or Nagarythe's black-fletched ranks.
It takes centuries to become this good, but the Asur have time on their side.
One of the most impressive, iconic sights of an Elven warhost is the wall of spears, perfectly arranged for maximum effect.
All citizens of Ulthuan must join a militia and attend regular training, by order of the Phoenix King.
The world's best archers require the very best arrows.
Ulthuan’s wardens have disembowelled savage hordes and unruly leviathans alike – the larger the foe, the surer their aim.
In times of war, it is best to be prepared for the long haul.
Wary of ruinous influence like no other, Asur call upon the Maiden for forgiveness in the same breath as they invoke the Bloody-Handed God.
"Nobility obliges me to recognise the virtue of an exceptional commoner."
Those of noble birth have the time to become well practiced in war's terrible arts.
Oft times, pride comes afore a fall. Not in this case.
Beautiful and deadly, an Asur Princess is a force to be reckoned with both at court and on the battlefield.
All Asur are excellent marksmen, but the wealthy Princesses of the noble families have access to the finest tutors and equipment to hone their skill.
Carefully placed magical wards protect our troops against the encroaching darkness.

effects.description:
Ward save: 10% when fighting against Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos, Chaos Dwarfs, Norsca and Beastmen
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: The Druchii are the greatest disappointment besmirching the legacy of the Asur. Eliminate them.

effects.description:
Physical resistance: 20% when fighting against Dark Elves
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: Nothing will distract us from our calling.

items.colour_text: No matter the weather, the Banner of Swiftness always flaps as if in a gale. Those who march under it, traverse the elements at a much greater pace.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

technology.short_description: We are strangers here and there are enemies as far as the eye can see. Prepare for the worst.

effects.description: Construction time: -1 for Wall and Garrison buildings

items.colour_text: This one aspires to mastery of fire magic, so it may be harnessed at will.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

technology.short_description: By allowing the farmers more autonomy the crop yields increase but the urban center forfeits some influence.

effects.description: Construction time: +1 for Province Capital/Settlement buildings

items.colour_text: "I sing in praise of Total War…"

technology.short_description: The daughter of Isha shares many secrets with the Asur.

Gifts of Isha generated: +1 per turn

technology.short_description: To rouse the fire of Asurian intensity is to command obedience – be they white-garbed neophytes or Nagarythe's black-fletched ranks.

effects.description:

	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)

technology.short_description: Barding of this kind gives the Reavers' mounts extra protection whilst they deliver their devastating charges.
It is both the right and duty of Ulthuan's perfect cavalry to repeat the achievements of their glorious ancestors.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for Ellyrian Reavers and Silver Helms units

technology.short_description: The forgemasters of the Dragon Spine have laboured through centuries to perfect intricacies unseen by the fleeting races of the world.

technology.short_description: Being able to control your steed with only your knees frees up the hands for blade, point or bow.

technology.short_description: The Asur regard the patronage of Loec with trepidation – his mirthful guise forever shadowed by the vindictiveness and trickery it conceals.
Ulthuan’s wardens have disembowelled savage hordes and unruly leviathans alike – the larger the foe, the surer their aim.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -2%
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)

technology.short_description: One gifted to interpret the firmament’s signs and heed the wing-borne tidings of Morai-Heg's messengers may weave the skeins of fate.

effects.description: Armour: +10 for Silver Helms and Dragon Princes units
Armour: +10 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace and Phoenix Guard units

technology.short_description: On one side Chaos surges, driven by the predation of hungry gods; on the other, a delectable mortal world. Between them, Ulthuan’s unremitting vigil.

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace, Phoenix Guard, Oceanids and Sea Elemental units
Weapon strength: +10% for White Lions of Chrace, Swordmasters of Hoeth and Phoenix Guard units

technology.short_description: To contemplate the Elves' most brilliant enchantment is to deepen one's attunement to magic – and to risk joining the black-robed magisters in its eternal conjuration.

effects.description:

	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)

technology.short_description: The finest suits of armour are forged in the Anvil of Vaul at Caledor, and contain the Smith-God's protection.

effects.description: Ward save: 10% for Dragon Princes units

technology.short_description: Knowledge of the end informs the individual and guides their actions.

effects.description: Ward save: 10% for Phoenix Guard units

technology.short_description: The call to personal valour is an important aspect of Ulthuan's preservation. Heroes will always be needed to face the darkness.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -2%
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)

technology.short_description: Few in number, the Archmages are the ultimate scholars. Prying them from their studies can be a bit difficult, but once they are set loose upon the battlefield all should fear their power.
The apprentices can assist with the Archmage's more mundane duties, allowing the Archmage to focus their mind on the greater undertaking.
The men of the Empire think themselves disciplined and well-trained. Most have less than a decade of martial experience, and their callow soldiers fall easily to true martial prowess.

effects.description:
Leadership aura size: +100% when fighting against Empire
	(all characters factionwide)

Attribute: Causes Terror when fighting against Empire
	(all characters factionwide)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

technology.short_description: By drilling against the small, nimble creatures of the wood, we hone our ability to strike down the weak yet horrifically numerous ratmen.

effects.description:
Bonus vs Infantry: +10 when fighting against Skaven
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: Without thought of self-preservation and without mercy, the fearless warriors of Nagarythe charge into the fray.
As one of the most powerful spell-casters in the world, Alarielle can bend the winds to her will.

effects.description: Gifts of Isha generated: +1 per turn

technology.short_description: Rage numbs pain, allowing the Nagarythi to shrug off minor wounds and continue the fight.

effects.description: Missile resistance: 5% when fighting against Dark Elves
Physical resistance: 5% when fighting against Dark Elves

technology.short_description: You think you have Khaine's favour? I will show you how very wrong you are.

effects.description:
Melee and missile weapon damage: +10%
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: Save for envoys and diplomats, very few outsiders travel beyond the Inner Sea’s lagoon of pleasurable commerce.
Long has the grey-garbed Mistwalker host turned to the annals of Moranion of Athel Tamarha, his teachings benefiting many.
It takes centuries to become this good, but the Asur have time on their side.
Some of the Asur's coastal colonies have fallen into disrepair and many colonists have maritime skills that could be useful to the Sea Guard at home.
"Whoso makes the pilgrimage to the Inner Sea where Ghyran teems and Aqshy swirls, shall be bound in spirit unto the elements."

effects.description: Melee attack: +4 for Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers and Silver Helms units

technology.short_description: The Elves of Tiranoc all know its battle song, a rousing anthem sung by their number since ancient times.
When a course takes several centuries to complete, you can be sure that its students know their subject inside and out.

effects.description: Hero recruit rank: +2 for Loremasters of Hoeth and Mages

technology.short_description: Knowledge of the end informs the individual and guides their actions.
Oft times, pride comes afore a fall. Not in this case.

effects.description: Recruit rank: +2 for White Lions of Chrace, Swordmaster, Phoenix Guard, Sisters of Avelorn and Dragon Princes units

technology.short_description: To the Asur, Dragons are not gods, but ancient divine creatures they treat as allies, the greatest of which are called upon through Caledorian ritual observances.
Those who have defended the gates of Ulthuan and fought in successful campaigns across her shores must lead the Asur in battle.
I will stand against any foe and fight tirelessly in defense of Ulthuan.
These worshippers of Lileath have spent too long in our ancient settlements. Perhaps it is time to take them back.

effects.description:
Bonus vs Large: +20 when fighting against Bretonnia
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: Defending yourself against the endless hoards of the undead is less about superior martial skill and more about paying attention.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +10 when fighting against Undead
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: The loyal beasts of the Asur are attuned to their masters; their rage mirrors our own.

effects.description: Bonus vs infantry: +10 for War Beasts and Monsters
Speed: +10% for War Beasts and Monsters
Melee defence: -5 for War Beasts and Monsters

technology.short_description: The Dragon Princes never dip their banners, and none dare remark upon their arrogance.

items.colour_text: Like his illustrious ancestor, this one can wake mighty Dragons and bind them to his will with harnesses of truesteel.

effects.description:
Recruitment cost: -10% for Dragon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +10 for Dragon and Dragon Prince units
	(Lord's army)

technology.short_description: For every Asur life lost a Druchii life will be taken.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Dark Elves
Missile strength: +15% when fighting against Dark Elves

technology.short_description: Do what must be done.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

technology.short_description: Those among the Sea Guard who show better-than-average aptitude may find themselves promoted in due course.
In the aftermath of the Sundering, the Elves of once-fair Tiranoc adapted to the masterful stewardship of the depths' primordial denizens.
According to Cothiquian wisdom, what certain lumbering sea-serpents lack in draconic sophistication they more than make up for with unwavering loyalty.
Whereby bolts and arrows can be stored for swift access when the ebb and flow of battle demands.
The young of the gleaming host boast their shattering volleys owe much to quicksilver drills, though veterans spare quiet thanks for the enchanters.
Whether drawn by Swiftfeather Rocs or Chracian Lions, they are chariots all the same – carriage, shaft, and yoke bearing the white-timbered elegance of Elven craft.
Halberds raised high and thrumming with the Flame Eternal, the silent sentinel conflagrate resolve and dread in equal measure.
"How can our enemies protect themselves when we throw the Flames of Asuryan and the Waters of Mathlann against them?"
Certain creatures are highly attuned to the Winds of Magic, making them that little bit more sensitive to the benefits of enchantment.
Both the song and the singer are crucial if Dragon and rider are to form a bond that lasts a lifetime.
The Naggarothi expend much energy and resources in trying to steal Dragon Eggs, prompting their Asur cousins to ward their allies' ancient lairs against infiltration.
The finest suits of armour are forged in the Anvil of Vaul at Caledor, and contain the Smith-God's protection.
The Everqueen's attendants are no mere courtiers, but selected from the finest warriors in Ulthuan.
Handmaidens of the Everqueen carry the blessing of their goddess with them into battle.
The War of the Beard was a great loss for the Asur. The Phoenix Crown will be ours once again.

effects.description:
Armour-piercing weapon damage: +100 when fighting against Dwarfs
	(all characters factionwide)

Armour-piercing weapon damage: +100 when fighting against Chaos Dwarfs
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: The mortal brutes are powerful indeed, with might to rival our own, but in knowing they face this deadliest of challenges, the Asur will excel.

effects.description:
Bonus vs Large: +20 when fighting against Ogres
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: The Druchii will learn to fear the shapes in the shadows.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -10% for cavalry units
Weapon strength: +10% for War Beasts and Monsters

technology.short_description: All will die, all will end. Once you accept this, there is nothing left to fear.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5
	(own armies factionwide in owned territory)

technology.short_description: As they slay their kin and raze their dark fortresses to dust, the Shadow Warriors come ever closer to keeping their oaths.

effects.description: Leadership: +5 when fighting against Dark Elves
Unit experience gain: +100% for units when fighting against Dark Elves

technology.short_description: The grim heirs of Anar stalk the shadowlands and terrorize the Druchii.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

technology.short_description: Just as abundant concentrations of magic can animate bodies of water, further arcane infusions can strengthen their primordial offspring.
A schedule of dangerous but swift delivery runs keeps the Sea Patrol within constant mustering reach of the nearest colony or outpost.
Aislinn’s notorious sacking of Marienburg set a standard for Asur imperialism, his infamy fuelling the fight at the limits of Ulthuan’s naval power.
Masters of study, learning, and battle.

effects.description: Hero capacity: +2 for Loremasters of Hoeth
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Loremasters of Hoeth

technology.short_description: The Loremasters will become proficient in any discipline they set their minds to; the martial mastery of the Swordmasters and magical prowess of the mages is a trifle for a Loremaster.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 for Loremasters of Hoeth
Miscast base chance: -5% for Loremasters of Hoeth

technology.short_description: The Slaan think themselves the greatest wielders of magic on the planet. The Asur have studied the Aethyr for millenia and can protect themselves from the arrogant lizards.

effects.description:
Bonus vs Large: +20 when fighting against Lizardmen
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: When our foes strike like cowards from afar, we simply rebuff their craven fusillades.

effects.description:
Vigour loss reduction: -10% when fighting against Cathay
	(all characters factionwide)

Missile resistance: 10% when fighting against Cathay
	(all characters factionwide)

technology.short_description: Their walls shudder before the might of the God of Smiths.

items.colour_text: "Like the Maker, we labour eternally in readiness for the great darkness that surely comes to consume the world."

technology.short_description: Beyond the safety and comfort of Ulthuan, the roving Knights of Caledor have innovated through necessity.

effects.description: Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition

items.colour_text: He watches and waits, constantly alert and ready for Druchii incursions through the passes of his homeland.

effects.description:
Ambush defence chance: +20%
	(all units in army)

technology.short_description: The Mother of Nature will cleanse this foul land.

items.colour_text: Their origins shrouded in the mists of time, Isha's priestesses officiate her mysterious rites on the Island of Rebirth.

effects.description:
Seduce Units budget: -15%
	(enemy Slaaneshi armies in local region)

technology.short_description: Hardened by age and the gusting Aethyr.

effects.description: Fire resistance: 20% for Dryad, Tree Kin, Grove Guardians and Treeman units
Missile resistance: 20% for Dryad, Tree Kin, Grove Guardians and Treeman units
Gifts of Isha generated: +1 per turn

technology.short_description: Many herds of fine Elven steeds roam freely on Ulthuan's wide plains, but can be called to battle when needed.

effects.description: Vigour loss reduction: -10% for cavalry units

technology.short_description: Barding of this kind gives the Reavers' mounts extra protection whilst they deliver their devastating charges.
The renowned smiths of Vaul and Hoeth forge greatswords so light and well-balanced they appear to be no lighter than a feather.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% for Swordmasters of Hoeth, White Lions of Chrace, Phoenix Guard and Dragon Princes units

technology.short_description: Setting rare gems into jewellery made from precious metals increases their value manyfold.
From the reign of Caledor the First, the White Lions of Chrace have wielded wild lore and savage fury to shield the heart of the Elven host.
"Pain, begone, I will have no more of thee!"
"Whoso makes the pilgrimage to the Inner Sea where Ghyran teems and Aqshy swirls, shall be bound in spirit unto the elements."
There is much to be learned at the Tower of Hoeth, be it history or swordplay.
On one side Chaos surges, driven by the predation of hungry gods; on the other, a delectable mortal world. Between them, Ulthuan’s unremitting vigil.
The calm, polite eloquence of the Asur ensures their easier acceptance by other cultures, where they may hear and even influence local intrigue.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +25%

technology.short_description: The Mages of Ulthuan are the masters of their respective lores and an invaluable asset to a competent commander.
Natural slivers and rods of Meteoric Iron can be forged into staves which serve as arcane focuses. They also make effective weapons in a pinch.
The Everqueen loves all her Asur kin, and is loved mightily in return.
Centuries of warfare have taught the Nagarythi the importance of slaughtering the Druchii from afar.

effects.description: Reload time reduction: +1% per rank achieved

technology.short_description: Without fear the Asur charge into battle against their ancestral foe.
Graceful even by the standards of the Asur, the Handmaidens move like the Aethyr.

effects.description: Gifts of Isha generated: +1 per turn

technology.short_description: Marksmanship skill is irrelevant when your target is obscured by shadow.
With swift steps, the most practiced Shadow-walkers can reposition in an instant.
Research the following items to advance the High Elves' prosperous economy to a higher level altogether.
Being able to control your steed with only your knees frees up the hands for blade, point or bow.
Minor nobles often choose a patron from more prestigious quarters, swearing allegiance to their house.
It is both the right and duty of Ulthuan's perfect cavalry to repeat the achievements of their glorious ancestors.
An eagle's senses match their speed in flight, making them excellent spotters and swift killers.
Thundering at dawn, the horn of the Hunter God heralds a bountiful hunt; keening at dusk, it portends lurking evil, warding all His children.
The maidens of Avelorn invoke the lands which they protect, and Isha, the Mother, answers.
When a course takes several centuries to complete, you can be sure that its students know their subject inside and out.
One gifted to interpret the firmament’s signs and heed the wing-borne tidings of Morai-Heg's messengers may weave the skeins of fate.
The Asur regard the patronage of Loec with trepidation – his mirthful guise forever shadowed by the vindictiveness and trickery it conceals.
Founded under Bel-Korhadris, the White Tower codified the Elven aptitude for magic into disciplines that pushed the boundaries of sorcery.
To contemplate the Elves' most brilliant enchantment is to deepen one's attunement to magic – and to risk joining the black-robed magisters in its eternal conjuration.
Millenia of experience with warfare, military strategy and tactics have formed the Asur into the greatest strategists in the world.
Trickery, deceit, and intrigue define the court of the Asur, much to Loec's enjoyment. The trickster god is always willing to lend aid to his followers.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors
Chance of being wounded after failure: -10%

technology.short_description: With grim resolve and endless vigilance, Eltharion's forces patrol Tor Yvresse and push the green tide deeper into the foul badlands.

effects.description: Attribute: Causes Terror when fighting against Greenskins

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

technology.short_description: The kin of Caledor the Conqueror remember their venerated Phoenix King and his vigorous spirit.

effects.description: Ward save: 5% for Dragon Princes units

items.colour_text: Bright blue steel can be enchanted to hold spells of great speed and deadly accuracy; the Elves of Ulthuan are masters of such magic.

technology.short_description: For we are the dragon rousers, and they stir for none but us.

effects.description: Local Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Dragon and Dragon Prince units

items.colour_text: A ring of a wrathful god will make its bearer faster, and more aggressive in his outlook.

related_attributes.bullet_text:
When charging into an enemy unit:
	  Charge Bonus duration is doubled.
	 Enemy units take a  Leadership penalty as if they have been attacked in the flank.

technology.short_description: We fear not the flame.

enabled_if: Winds of magic power less than 50%

technology.short_description: Empowered by age, wisdom, and anger, the tree spirits stand resolutely against the forces of Chaos.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +25% for Dryads, Tree Kin, Grove Guardians and Treeman units
Gifts of Isha generated: +1 per turn

technology.short_description: With his studies completed, Teclis finally turns his full attention toward the malevolent powers corrupting the world. Woe be to his enemies.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs single and multiple units

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve minimum: +20
Number of uses: +1 for Winds of Magic army abilities

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs single and multiple units

effects.description: Spell resistance: 20% for Swordmasters of Hoeth and Loremasters of Hoeth

technology.short_description: They wander always, their perpetual vigil never ending.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
